alert.note: Alert for Dallas; Ellis (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 03 at 7:01PM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Ellis and southwestern Dallas Counties through 730 PM CDT... At 700 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Desoto, moving south at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Dallas, Desoto, Cedar Hill, Duncanville, Lancaster, Waxahachie, Midlothian, Glenn Heights, Red Oak, Hutchins, Wilmer, Ovilla, Ferris, Oak Leaf, Pecan Hill and India. This includes the following highways... Interstate 35E between mile markers 405 and 421. Interstate 20 between mile markers 460 and 472. Interstate 45 between mile markers 264 and 272, and between mile markers 276 and 278. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
